title: What particular writing style should I need to apply when writing an academic essay? - Quora

response.answer_text: Your professor will tell you what style you should write in. For example, when I was studying for my BS in Psychology, my professors told me to write in APA style, which is used in a number of academic disciplines, including psychology. When I began work on my MA in Women’s Studies, I was told to write in MLA style, which is used in a number of academic disciplines including some women’s studies programs. Sometimes a course you’re taking as an elective will be in a style different from your own department’s style and then, for that one course, you have to write in the style your professor’s discipline uses. It’s complex, but your professor always knows which style is appropriate in his discipline and for the material you’re studying.

Whatever your instructor requires, and than can vary. In grad school, I wrote an essay in a very flashy style for a course in Modernism and Orientalism. I got praise “your words have wings” and told I should publish it. The next semester I took a course in twentieth century European criticism. I wrote my first paper the same way. I got a D and was told to leave the style for fiction. I adjusted my style to the dry as a bone academic style that professor liked and got an A in the class. Both. I.e. KNOW your instructor. Ask.
